intro: Tabernaemontana ecarinata, commonly known as the horned nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and toxic compounds. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. Its leaves are typically oval and have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a fleshy, orange-red berry that contains seeds, though the plant is generally considered poisonous due to its toxic alkaloids.
